channel.title: NPR Topics: News
channel.description: NPR news, audio, and podcasts. Coverage of breaking stories, national and world news, politics, business, science, technology, and extended coverage of major national and world events.
channel.copyright: Copyright 2024 NPR - For Personal Use Only

item.title: Supermarket merger could change grocery prices. And, a deadly mosquito-borne disease
item.description: Kroger and Albertsons say the merger of the supermarkets could help with grocery prices. And, what is EEE? A fatal mosquito-borne disease that was detected in Massachusetts.
item.content:encoded:
Kroger and Albertsons say the merger of the supermarkets could help with grocery prices. And, what is EEE? A fatal mosquito-borne disease that was detected in Massachusetts.

(Image credit: Daisy-Daisy)
item.dc:creator: Brittney Melton

item.title: Insurers can restrict mental health care. What laws protect patients in your state?
item.description: It can be really hard to get mental health care in the U.S. Even if you find a therapist in network, your insurer can refuse to cover the prescribed treatment. Here are the laws protecting patients.
item.content:encoded:
It can be really hard to get mental health care in the U.S. Even if you find a therapist in network, your insurer can refuse to cover the prescribed treatment. Here are the laws protecting patients.

(Image credit: Javi Sanz/Getty Images)
item.dc:creator: Annie Waldman

item.title: As Harris inches ahead, the cavalry comes to Trump’s aid on the airwaves
item.description: Republicans aligned with former President Trump have been spending more on ads since Vice President Harris entered the race for President.
item.content:encoded:
Republicans aligned with former President Trump have been spending more on ads since Vice President Harris entered the race for President.

(Image credit: Rebecca Noble/Getty Images)
item.dc:creator: Domenico Montanaro

item.title: Photos: Ukrainians celebrate their Independence Day by running in vyshyvankas
item.description: Ukrainian diaspora in Washington, D.C., runs in vyshyvankas to mark Independence Day and support war relief efforts.
item.content:encoded:
'/>

Ukrainian diaspora in Washington, D.C., runs in vyshyvankas to mark Independence Day and support war relief efforts.

(Image credit: Michael A. McCoy for NPR)
item.dc:creator: Lilly Quiroz

item.title: Separatist group claims multiple attacks that killed over 40 people in Pakistan
item.description: The outlawed Baluchistan Liberation Army group warned in a statement overnight into Tuesday of more attacks.
item.content:encoded:
The outlawed Baluchistan Liberation Army group warned in a statement overnight into Tuesday of more attacks.

(Image credit: Rahmat Khan)
item.dc:creator: The Associated Press

item.title: The Gallagher brothers are reuniting for an Oasis tour 15 years after breaking up
item.description: The Gallagher brothers had a longstanding feud for decades, and the band broke up for good in 2009.
item.content:encoded:
The Gallagher brothers had a longstanding feud for decades, and the band broke up for good in 2009.

(Image credit: Leon Neal)
item.dc:creator: Ayana Archie

item.title: A 102-year-old woman becomes the United Kingdom’s oldest skydiver
item.description: Manette Baillie broke the record Sunday during a tandem jump in eastern England. She was raising money for three organizations, including her local veterans club.
item.content:encoded:
Manette Baillie broke the record Sunday during a tandem jump in eastern England. She was raising money for three organizations, including her local veterans club.

(Image credit: UK Parachuting and Goldster/Handout via Reuters)
item.dc:creator: Joe Hernandez

item.title: We asked Democrats in red and purple districts: How will you win votes this election?
item.description: To win the White House, the Harris-Walz ticket will need to appeal to voters in purple areas, and maybe even red ones. We asked Democrats who live in those parts of the country what could make that happen.
item.content:encoded:
To win the White House, the Harris-Walz ticket will need to appeal to voters in purple areas, and maybe even red ones. We asked Democrats who live in those parts of the country what could make that happen.

(Image credit: Charly Triballeau)
item.dc:creator: Ari Shapiro

item.title: A rideshare driver makes an hourslong trek to take a dad to his gravely ill daughter
item.description: When Ian Sandler got a middle-of-the-night call that his daughter had collapsed, he didn't know what to do. Then, an Uber driver went above and beyond to help.
item.content:encoded:
When Ian Sandler got a middle-of-the-night call that his daughter had collapsed, he didn't know what to do. Then, an Uber driver went above and beyond to help.

(Image credit: Ian Sandler)
item.dc:creator: Autumn Barnes

item.title: Sid Eudy, the professional wrestler known as 'Sid Vicious,' dies at 63
item.description: Eudy wrestled in several professional leagues over the course of his career, starred on teams such as The Skyscrapers and the Four Horsemen and won 2 WWE and WCW titles.
item.content:encoded: Eudy wrestled in several professional leagues over the course of his career, starred on teams such as The Skyscrapers and the Four Horsemen and won 2 WWE and WCW titles.
item.dc:creator: Ayana Archie
